intro: Erucastrum legati-herbette, commonly known as the mountain mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in a fine layer of white hair. Erucastrum legati-herbette is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
